title: TC001-User Registration with 14-Day Free Trial
description: Verify that a new user can successfully register with valid details and starts with a 14-day free trial.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # Click on the 'Registre-se' link to go to the registration page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/div[3]/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Try to input text into the 'Nome Completo' field (index 3) using a different approach or skip and continue with other fields.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div[2]/div/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div[2]/div/form/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin User')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('11999999999')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div[2]/div/form/div[3]/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@songmetrix.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div[2]/div/form/div[4]/div/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin@@2024')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div[2]/div/form/div[5]/div/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin@@2024')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div[2]/div/form/div[6]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Assertion: Verify registration success message with 14-day free trial
        assert free_trial_text := await frame.locator('text=14 dias grátis ativados!').text_content()
        assert free_trial_text is not None and '14 dias grátis ativados!' in free_trial_text
          
        # Assertion: Verify confirmation email message is shown
        email_confirmation_message = await frame.locator('text=Confirme seu email para começar').text_content()
        assert email_confirmation_message is not None and 'Confirme seu email para começar' in email_confirmation_message
          
        email_confirmation_details = await frame.locator('text=Enviamos um email de confirmação para você. Não esqueça de verificar sua caixa de spam.').text_content()
        assert email_confirmation_details is not None and 'Enviamos um email de confirmação para você. Não esqueça de verificar sua caixa de spam.' in email_confirmation_details
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC002-Login with Valid Credentials
description: Check login succeeds with valid username/email and password.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # Input registered username/email and correct password.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/form/div/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@songmetrix.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin@@2024')
        

        # Click on the login button to submit the form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/form/div[3]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Assertion: Verify user is authenticated and redirected to the dashboard by checking the presence of dashboard elements
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        dashboard_section = frame.locator('text=Dashboard')
        assert await dashboard_section.is_visible(), 'Dashboard section is not visible, login might have failed'
        # Additional check: verify some key dashboard data is present and correct type
        active_radios_text = await frame.locator('text=active_radios').first().text_content()
        assert active_radios_text is not None, 'Active radios info not found on dashboard'
        top_artists_text = await frame.locator('text=top_5_artists_executions').first().text_content()
        assert top_artists_text is not None, 'Top artists executions info not found on dashboard'
        # Optionally check page title to confirm redirection
        page_title = await frame.title()
        assert 'Dashboard' in page_title or 'SongMetrix' in page_title, 'Page title does not indicate dashboard'
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC004-Dashboard Data Load Performance
description: Verify dashboard loads all required data and visualizations within 3 seconds under normal load conditions.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # Input email and password, then submit login form to access dashboard.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/form/div/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@songmetrix.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin@@2024')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/form/div[3]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Check if all required dashboard data and visualizations are fully loaded and visible. Then perform multiple access attempts to check uptime and responsiveness.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div/div/nav/div/div').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Navigate back to the dashboard page to perform multiple access attempts for uptime and responsiveness testing.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173', timeout=10000)
        

        # Perform multiple access attempts to check dashboard uptime and responsiveness over time.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/dashboard', timeout=10000)
        

        # Continue performing multiple access attempts to check dashboard uptime and responsiveness over time.
        await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/dashboard', timeout=10000)
        

        # Assert that the dashboard page title is correct to confirm page load
        assert await page.title() == 'SongMetrix - Monitoramento de Rádios'
        # Assert that the Core Web Vitals FCP (First Contentful Paint) is under 3000ms (3 seconds)
        fcp_text = await frame.locator('xpath=//div[contains(text(),"FCP")]').text_content()
        fcp_value_ms = int(''.join(filter(str.isdigit, fcp_text)))
        assert fcp_value_ms <= 3000, f'FCP is too high: {fcp_value_ms}ms'
        # Assert that there are no critical warnings in Session Summary
        warnings_text = await frame.locator('xpath=//div[contains(text(),"Warnings")]/following-sibling::div').text_content()
        warnings_count = int(''.join(filter(str.isdigit, warnings_text)))
        assert warnings_count == 0, f'Found {warnings_count} warnings in session summary'
        # Assert that key dashboard metrics are present and valid
        active_radios = await frame.locator('xpath=//div[contains(text(),"Active Radios (Your Format)")]/following-sibling::div').text_content()
        executions = await frame.locator('xpath=//div[contains(text(),"Executions (Top 5 Artists)")]/following-sibling::div').text_content()
        main_genre = await frame.locator('xpath=//div[contains(text(),"Main Genre")]/following-sibling::div').text_content()
        assert int(active_radios) > 0, 'Active Radios count should be greater than 0'
        assert int(executions) > 0, 'Executions count should be greater than 0'
        assert main_genre.strip() != '', 'Main Genre should not be empty'
        # Perform multiple access attempts to check uptime and responsiveness
        for _ in range(3):
            await page.goto('http://localhost:5173/dashboard', timeout=10000)
            assert await page.title() == 'SongMetrix - Monitoramento de Rádios'
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC013-System Notifications Delivery
description: Verify users receive system notifications for significant platform changes and subscription updates.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # Input email and password, then submit login form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/form/div/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@songmetrix.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin@@2024')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/form/div[3]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Trigger a system notification event such as subscription renewal or new feature release.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div/div/nav/div[11]/div').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Fill in the notification title and message to simulate a subscription renewal notification and submit the form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div[2]/main/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Subscription Renewal Notice')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div[2]/main/div/div/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/textarea').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Your subscription has been successfully renewed. Thank you for staying with us!')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div[2]/main/div/div/div[2]/div/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Check the platform interface notification center (bell icon) for the new notification.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div[2]/header/div/div[2]/div/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Verify user receives the notification via email by checking the email inbox or email management interface.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div/div/nav/div[9]/div').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Check the 'Logs' tab to verify if the subscription renewal notification email was sent successfully.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div[2]/main/div/div/div/div/button[3]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        assert False, 'Test plan execution failed: Unable to verify system notification receipt.'
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # Input email and password, then click login button to access the dashboard.

        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@songmetrix.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin@@2024')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/form/div[3]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Navigate to SQL Console to execute the provided database optimization scripts.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div/div/nav/div[10]/div').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Try to clear the textarea using the 'Limpar' button and then attempt to input the SQL script again.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div[2]/main/div/div/div/div[2]/div[2]/button[2]').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Final generic failing assertion since expected result is unknown
        assert False, 'Test plan execution failed: generic failure assertion.'
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())

code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None
    
    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()
        
        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )
        
        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)
        
        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()
        
        # Navigate to your target URL and wait until the network request is committed
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5173", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # Wait for the main page to reach DOMContentLoaded state (optional for stability)
        try:
            await page.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
        except async_api.Error:
            pass
        
        # Iterate through all iframes and wait for them to load as well
        for frame in page.frames:
            try:
                await frame.wait_for_load_state("domcontentloaded", timeout=3000)
            except async_api.Error:
                pass
        
        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # Input email and password, then submit login form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/form/div/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('admin@songmetrix.com')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/form/div[2]/div/div/div/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Admin@@2024')
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[2]/div[2]/div/form/div[3]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Locate and navigate to Spotify integration dashboard area or playlist section.
        await page.mouse.wheel(0, window.innerHeight)
        

        frame = context.pages[-1]
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=html/body/div/div[3]/div/div/nav/div[12]/div').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        

        # Final generic failing assertion since test plan execution failed and expected result is unknown
        assert False, 'Test plan execution failed: generic failure assertion'
        await asyncio.sleep(5)
    
    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()
            
asyncio.run(run_test())
